summary:
Liebe Kollegen, liebe KollegInnen! 
Dear Colleagues
I studied European Languages and Business from 1987-1991 (BA Hons) before returning to Germany to work for an American company in Frankfurt am Main. As part of my primary degree, I spent my third year in Germany from 1989-1990 where I experienced the Fall of the Berlin Wall and the end of communism across Eastern Europe whilst working in a bank in Solingen (Nordrhein-Westphalen).
Having returned to Belfast in 1993, I completed a PGCE at QUB and am both a qualified teacher of Modern Languages as well as TEFL trained. I have also worked as a Teacher of English for the Bildungsministerium (Ministry of Education) in the State of Brandenburg. 
I graduated with an MSSc (European Integration-based on the economic, political and social aspects of the EU) from QUB in 1997 and completed a DASE (Diploma in the Advanced Study of Education) in 2001 covering six modules including Special Educational Needs (two modules), Counselling Skills, Early Years, Language Learning and Comparative Global Education. 
I am a fluent German speaker, competent In French with a knowledge of Italian and have been employed at the British Council Northern Ireland since June 2000 as a Programme Manager (APM Qualified) for UK, EU and Global Projects delivered through a Project Management Framework
I have a track record of delivering quality projects primarily on Education and Skills; and have established excellent working relations with Embassies and the European Commission.
In my current post, I manage a language based Global  portfolio with particular responsibility for Northern Ireland and French speaking countries (Belgium, France,  and Québec) and Italy across the UK. 
I am a champion for Equality, Diversity and Inclusion (EDI) within the organisation.  I am a member of the Cultural Engagement EDI Steering Group which was established to advise Senior Management on all aspects of EDI within the organisation and to embed EDI throughout the project cycle/customer journey in the UK and with our 15 global partners.
I have also been trained to roll out Unconscious Bias training to staff in the UK in support of the organisation’s Anti-Racism Action Plan including unconscious interview  training which I implemented recently (April 22).
After careful consideration, I left the British Council in June 2022 on a voluntary exit programme.
I am now looking forward to new challenges and opportunities within a global project management context for an organisation with similar inclusive values. 
Mit freundlichem Gruß
Best Wishes
Simon

profile_positions.description:
I have been a Project Manager working in the field of diversity, cultural relations, social inclusion and education since 1996.
From 2000 to 2010, I managed the school strand of the European Commission funded Socrates and Life Long Learning Programne including eTwinning (part of the EU's e-learning programme from 2005); an online virtual classroom (using a secure platform managed by the Central Support Service-CSS- in Brussels) for schools and students across the EU which developed pedagogic, ICT and language skills. As a leading member of the UK Team, I built up effective working relations with partners (including Léargas in Dublin) across Europe and as recognition of my skills was offered a secondment with the CSS in Brussels to further enhance the programme. 
I currently manage a language focused HE Programme (Language Assistants) with a portfolio covering NI (for French, German, Irish, Mandarin and Spanish) GB (French and Italian) with partners in Belgium, France, Italy and Quebec. 
As a fluent German speaker, I have established excellent working relations with the Goethe-Insitut and German Embassy in London which required me to attend various events across the UK. To support the French and Spanish HE students in Northern Ireland, I work with the French (London) and Spanish (Dublin) Embassies; other British Council Offices across the UK as well as those in Berlin, Vienna and Beijing.
I plan to move on from the British Council after 22 years and  I am open to new areas challenges in 2022 which will inspire me professionally.
Throughout my career, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion has been central to my delivery as a Diversity Trainer and Manager.  I have ensured that EDI is applied to all programme activity, customer journey and also identified gaps in staffs' professional skills, knowledge and experience as a member of the EDI Strategic Management Committee.  As a result, training was offered across the organisation to enhance EDI skills to meet targets.
